text: Kristine Moore Gebbie (June 26, 1943 â€“ May 17, 2022) was an American academic and public health official. She was a professor at the Flinders University School of Nursing & Midwifery in Adelaide, Australia. She was born in Sioux City, Iowa. Gebbie was the White House AIDS Policy Coordinator from 1993 until 1994 during the Bill Clinton administration. Gebbie died on May 17, 2022 in Adelaide from cancer, aged 78.Kristine Gebbie, the First U.S. AIDS Czar, Dies at 78 ==References== Category:1943 births Category:2022 deaths Category:Scientists from Iowa Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians Category:Politicians from Sioux City, Iowa Category:Australian academics Category:American nurses Category:Public health
title: Kristine Gebbie
